node.name: Stimulus
node.description: Input from outside world, exogenous

node.name: Cross
node.description: By default a vertical-horizontal cross, for rotated add /rotated/ tag
In degrees
In candela, e.g 25 cd
In degrees, e.g 5 deg

node.name: Uniform Color
node.description: These are CSS 3 basic color names, available in Appendix 1
R value of RGB, between 0 and 1
B value of RGB, between 0 and 1
G value of RGB, between 0 and 1
H value of HSV, between 0 and 1
S value of HSV, between 0 and 1
V value of HSV, between 0 and 1

node.name: Achromatic
node.description: Gray, is only in black, white or between
White intensity between 0 and 1

node.name: Screen Location
node.description: If centered at a screen location, not all over the screen

node.name: Angle
node.description: Clockwise angle
Displacement from screen center, in any direction, in degrees

node.name: Up-down Separated
node.description: Stimuli presented both at the top and the bottom of fovea
Separation in degrees

node.name: Bilateral
node.description: For bilateral visual field stimulus presentations
Separation in degrees

node.name: Foveal
node.description: Presented exactly where the subject is now looking

node.name: Peripheral
node.description: Presented where the subject is not directly looking
Hour:Min

node.name: Social
node.description: e.g., mother-child interaction, videotaped or animated by a triangle and a square

node.name: On Screen
node.description: Note: above, also need/could use starting position on screen, end position, velocity in deg/s, etc.

node.name: Down
node.description: e.g. /2 deg

node.name: Right
node.description: e.g. /3 deg

node.name: Steady State
node.description: Fixed stimulus onset asynchrony
flicker rate in Hz

node.name: Film Clip
node.description: Any clip from a commercial film, TV,...

node.name: Pseudo-character
node.description: Alphabet-like, but not really

node.name: Letter
node.description: Authograph, valid letters including numbers, e.g. A, B, 5...

node.name: Proper
node.description: A proper noun, refers to a unique entity, such as London, Jupiter, ...

node.name: Common
node.description: Refers to a class of entities (cities, planets, persons, corporations), or non-unique instances of a certain class (a city, another planet, these persons, our corporation)
Number of words
Number of sentences
Number of paragraphs

node.name: Drawing
node.description: e.g. cartoons

node.name: IAPS
node.description: International Affective Picture System

node.name: Bistable
node.description: This could be either abstract line drawings or object illustrations

node.name: Uniform Color
node.description: These are CSS 3 basic color names, available in Appendix 1
R value of RGB, between 0 and 1
B value of RGB, between 0 and 1
G value of RGB, between 0 and 1
H value of HSV, between 0 and 1
S value of HSV, between 0 and 1
V value of HSV, between 0 and 1

node.name: Reward
node.description: e.g., trumpets!

node.name: Nameable
node.description: Could be described by a word
In dB

node.name: ABR
node.description: Auditory Brainstem Response

node.name: Colored
node.description: Not white, 1/f, spectrum
In Hz
Number of words
Number of sentences
Number of paragraphs

node.name: Real world sounds
node.description: People, machines, etc..

node.name: add file name
node.description: File name or quoted path name
Relative azimuth of the sound, preferably in degrees, clockwise
Relative elevation of the sound, preferably in degrees

node.name: With SPGS
node.description: SPGS = spatial position guiding system

node.name: Without SPGS
node.description: SPGS = spatial position guiding system

node.name: Target
node.description: Something the subject is looking for is detected.

node.name: Oddball
node.description: Unexpected, infrequent
Probability, between 0 and 1

node.name: Novel
node.description: Genuine once or so per experiment event

node.name: Expected
node.description: Of low information value

node.name: Correct
node.description: Confirm, something went well, last action was correct

node.name: Expected
node.description: Feedback was expected, for example they were often correct and they are again correct

node.name: Unexpected
node.description: Feedback was unexpected, for example they were often incorrect and they are now correct

node.name: On Accuracy
node.description: Feedback was provided by evaluating their accuracy

node.name: On Reaction Time
node.description: Feedback was provided by evaluating their reaction time

node.name: To Other
node.description: Observed feedback to another person, typically in a social paradigm

node.name: Deterministic
node.description: Should have a fixed relationship to what happened before

node.name: Stochastic
node.description: Non-deterministic, it does not have fixed relationship with what has happened before in the experiment
Monetary values in some currency, for example $1, or the ratio of the reward to the maximum possible (3 of max 10 becomes 0.3), or x points
Absolute monetary values in some currency, for example $1, or the ratio of the reward to the maximum possible (3 of max 10 becomes 0.3)

node.name: Planned
node.description: The error feedback was given regardless of the validity of subject response, e.g in a yoked design

node.name: Task Rest Start
node.description: Stop doing the task and rest, or just rest if the task has not yet begun

node.name: Task Rest End
node.description: Stop resting and prepare for or start performing the task

node.name: Presented action of another person
node.description: e.g., saw someone pick up something

node.name: Liminal
node.description: At the 75%/25% perception threshold

node.name: Offset
node.description: vs. Onset

node.name: Semantic
node.description: Semantic similarity

node.name: Response
node.description: Self-initiated action

node.name: Button Hold
node.description: Press and keep pressed

node.name: Turn
node.description: Change in direction of movement

node.name: Object
node.description: Point to an object

node.name: Direction
node.description: Point to a direction

node.name: Close
node.description: and keep closed for ~0.1 s or more

node.name: Open
node.description: and keep open for ~0.1 s or more
A number between 0 and 1
A number between 0 and 1
A number between 0 and 1
A number between 0 and 1
A number between 0 and 1
A number between 0 and 1

node.name: Competitive
node.description: Subject is competing against an opponent, for example when the faster respondent wins

node.name: Social Interaction
node.description: Social

node.name: Pseudo
node.description: Instructed so but actually not, the other person may not exist in real world, e.g. be a computer program agent

node.name: Passive
node.description: Not engaged in any particular task

node.name: Sustained
node.description: Being alert

node.name: To a Location
node.description: Spatial

node.name: Participant
node.description: For identifying different participants in social, multi-person experiments

node.name: Role
node.description: The role of the participant associated with the event, e.g. viewer, follower, leader, is placed at a lower level, e.g. Participant/Role/Leader

node.name: ID
node.description: subject may swap their roles during the experiment but still need to be each identified by a unique ID, which may or may not be numeric. For example all stimuli presented to a particular participant is tagged as: Participant/ID/Player 1

node.name: Context
node.description: Describes the context of the whole experiment, also includes tags that are common across all events. Add common tags across all stimuli/ and/or responses here, e.g if all experiment events share /State/Drowsy, you can place it here instead of tagging each event individually

node.name: Prone
node.description: e.g. on a bed

node.name: # Speed
node.description: (meters per second)

node.name: # Speed
node.description: (meters per second)

node.name: Clinic
node.description: Recording in a clinical setting, e.g. in a hospital or doctor’s office

node.name: Motion platform
node.description: Subject is on a motion platform, e.g. simulated car movements
Distance in meters from subject eyes to the presentation screen , e.g. 0.3 for 30 cm from subject eyes to the monitor

node.name: Experiment Control
node.description: Information about states and events of the software program that controls the experiment
Permutation number/code used for permuted experiment parts
Block number
Block number
Trial number
Trial number

node.name: Task
node.description: Task-specific events, such as moving a piece in a chess game

node.name: Incorrect
node.description: e.g. due to timeout

node.name: Experiment Parameters
node.description: Experiment parameters in some (quoted) string

node.name: Custom
node.description: This node can be used to organize events in an alternative (parallel) hierarchy: you can define your custom tags and hierarchies without any restriction under this node. These tags will still be matched to each other, for example /Custom/Dance/Waltz is considered a subtype of /Custom/Dance.

node.name: Behavioral rating inventory of executive function
Choice task between risky and non-risky options
Fagerstrom test for nicotine dependence (Cognitive Atlas Term)
Mini mental state examination (Cognitive Atlas Term)
Modified erikson scale of communication attitudes
Non-choice task to study expected value and uncertainty
Label
node.description: A short label for the event. For example /Label/Accept Button. Please note that the information under this tag will not be used in the analysis and is provided solely for the convenience in referring to events in the context of a single study.

node.name: Description
node.description: A detailed description of the event as text, can be used to complement information encoded in other HED tags. Please note that information under this tag would be unusable by computers and analysis software and should not be used as the main method for describing events (use HED tags other than Description and Label to explain events in a machine-understandable manner)

node.name: Group ID
node.description: A string that uniquely identifies a group of related of events, e.g. events that describe visual and auditory stimulus onsets and offsets of a particular bird may all be tagged with /Group ID/Bird #54

node.name: HED
node.description: HED specification version number: normally there is no need to specify the version number in the HED string since it will be matched by default to the most recent compliant version, but this tag can be used to specify the exact HED version the HED string was based on.
